headline: Tex-Mex Turkey Soup
description: Shredded turkey in a tomato-based soup is jazzed up with herbs and spices for a rich and warming alternative to leftover turkey sandwiches.
name: Tex-Mex Turkey Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can black beans, rinsed, drained
1 cup shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add minced onions and cook until onions begin to soften, about 4 minutes. Add garlic, chili powder, cumin and oregano and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.

Stir in water, tomato soup, diced tomatoes, salsa, shredded turkey, parsley and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes or until bouillon cubes dissolve. Add black beans, corn, sour cream and cilantro. Simmer for 20 to 30 minutes.
Serve soup with crushed tortilla chips, chopped green onion, shredded cheese and additional cilantro and sour cream.

review.reviewBody: My Husband loved this soup I'm not a great cook but this recipe made it look like I'm a great cook only thing changed was I used dry black beans not canned
Delicious! Was a big hit with everyone and is definitely going in the make it again (soon) file!
Great way to use leftover Turkey. This soup was delicious.
Excellent with leftover smoked turkey
it was really great - filling and tasty and perfect even if the real turkey came out a bit dry! everyone had seconds! we will do this yearly for sure!

Amazing recipe and one that I think you can adjust/add to based on what you have. I was a little skeptical about adding tomato soup but it really gave it a velvelty type texture and a nice taste. Thanks so much for this recipe.

I used this soup as inspiration because I had a ton of leftover turkey, but I was missing sour cream and didn’t have time to go to the store. My family tends to like broth based soups, so I followed the recipe, doubling the spices, and leaving out the sour cream and cheese, and it was superb! I know it’s not exactly the soup recorded here, but the elements I used were wonderful, and I look forward to making it again with all the ingredients!
Skipped the soup and used broth instead of water. Yummy!
It was very good . But I like a little more spice.

A good recipe to use the Thanksgiving Turkey leftovers! And a nice change from the creamy kind of soup. I had about 3 Lb of cooked turkey with bones in my freezer that I thawed overnight, so I used the bones with little bit of the attached meat to make a turkey broth in lieu of water and bouillon cubes. The other change I made was to reduce the tomatoes. I don't like soups that are too "tomatoey", so I skipped the tomato soup ( I never buy canned soups anyway) and used less diced tomatoes. Next time I will use 2 cans of beans to make the soup heartier. I served this soup with some avocado toasts.
This recipe is fantastic. What a great use of leftover Turkey from the holidays. I didn’t change a thing. Whole family loves it!
YUM is the first thing that comes to mind!! Super easy, smells fantastic and tastes even better! I saved the sour cream just for a garnish but followed the rest of the recipe to a T!
Really good soup and a great way to use up turkey.
One of our family favorites! We use chicken or turkey. Whatever we have. Try spicing it up with a jalapeño!
Awesome soup! So flavorful. I used the turkey carcass to make broth and it was wonderful!
Whole family loved it! We didn't use the corn chips because we used it as just the soup. Still awesome!
I love this so much!!!

It was kind of bland. I was able to improve upon the leftovers by adding a fair bit more spice, including 1/2 a packet of taco seasonings. I would make it again with more spice, as it turned out quite well after I'd doctored it up a bit.

This soup was superb. I used homemade turkey stock instead of water and chicken bouillon, and I substituted frozen fire roasted corn from Trader Joe’s for the frozen corn. My husband thought it was the best soup I’ve ever made. I will make it again and again. Joan C.

Family loved it! I followed your recipe with 2 exceptions. I couldn't find the the jalapeño cream cheese so I used onion cream cheese and added a can of pinto beans (my family's preference). Leftovers were just as good, and I served it with warm corn tortillas. I will definitely make this again! I'm happy you shared it!

Such a great recipe for left over turkey. I did modify the recipe to a crock pot version where I threw everything into the pot and let it slow cook until dinner time because I’m a busy mom of 3 and like to utilize the crock pot’s ability to make dinner time quicker. Added sour cream and cheese toppings to serve. Turned out soooo delicious will be making again for sure !
Really yummy. First time making it I only put in 1/2 of the chili powder because I wanted my kids to eat it. But it was not spicy at all!! Next time I'm adding the full amount.

This is the best use of leftover turkey ever! I made this recipe as submitted except I had a small garnet yam on hand, so I diced it and added it to the soup. Simmered for 15 minutes before adding the turkey, beans, and corn. Really excellent!
I forgot to say that instead of water and chicken bullion, I used the juices from the turkey (which was about half) and then veggie stock I had on hand. I am so impressed with this recipe!
Amazing! One of the best things I've made in a long time. Not overly spicy so you can kick it up to your preference with your own hot sauce.

Great comfort soup for a cold and rainy evening. Instead of water I used broth made from leftover turkey carcass and celery sprigs. Added turkey meat that fell off bones during cooking - result was a more flavorful soup. Used minced dry onions instead of flakes and just a dash of chili powder. With the toppings, it made for a great dinner.

I have made this soup a day or two after Thanksgiving dinner with the leftover turkey for several years now. My family loves it and looks forward to this meal almost as much as they do Thanksgiving every year. Enjoy!

This soup is delicious! I used the "Juicy Thanksgiving Turkey" recipe on here submitted by Kirsten (thanks Kirsten) and then decided to try this soup recipe with my turkey leftovers and it is wonderful--the only change I made was to dump everything in my crockpot and cook for 2 hours on high and added 1 cup of my turkey stock that was leftover from cooking my turkey in lieu of 1 of the 4 cups of water for this recipe; add some cornbread and you have a great quick meal that is healthy and comforting! I did rinse my turkey leftovers before shredding and putting in the crockpot as there was some of the rub left on them and I didn't want that to interfere with the flavor of the soup. Thanks!
Made as directed. Loved it. A definite keeper!

We loved it, but used what I had here at home so somethings were changed. One of can corn and the other was cream corn, and used rotel tomatoes instead of diced, also used chicken broth and added tablespoon of chicken broth base for added flavor. Yum Yum!!!!
Yes !
No changes. Yes, i gave made this several times. Perfect as written.

So good. Used up aging canned corn and other ingredients. Only used half the salsa and it was still spicy for the kids. Next time I’m going to marinate the chicken pieces overnight because it was a bit bland in the center of chicken. Used veggie broth instead of water and used fresh tomatoes instead of canned. I couldn’t believe that the kids ate all the veggies up! Will definitely make again!
This soup is delicious. If you don't like Taco/Chili seasoning this might not be the soup for you. I do like it spicier so I added a little crushed red pepper. I will make this soup again.

I made this a few months ago. It was Wonderful. I did make a few adjustments. I make bone broth from the turkey carcass (instead of water & bullion cubes). I left out cilantro, family hates it. I used low sodium tomato soup & mild salsa, low fat sour cream. Family LOVED it! I should have made more to eat later. This recipe was a Big hit!
Used home made turkey stock instead of bouillon & water. No beans.
Turned out very good substituted V8 juice for tomato soup.
Very Good will make again!!!
Delicious.
Easy to make, absolutely delicious, a new favorite in our home .
Excellent recipe for left over turkey- loved it!
I really liked it . Added plain yogurt before serving. Omitted sour cream. I will make again.
Easy to make, tasted great, great option for leftover turkey.

Thank you so much for this recipe. AMAZING. Followed exactly, with only one exception in using home made broth. Hubs stated it was the best tex-mex soup he has ever had, and I would have to agree. I also like the addition of a touch of fresh squeezed lime juice at serving, which just brightened everything up. Total keeper. Make this now. Cheers
It was yummy! I doubled the ingredients, more garlic, cumin etc. The soup had wonderful flavor and I will definitely make it again, family loved it!
Great broth. Lots of ingredients so it took some hunt through the cupboard time. I would definitely make this again
Triple the spices!

Yum!!! The only thing I changed was to use pinto instead of black beans because I didn’t have any. This is going into the regular rotation. For day to day I’d probably use chicken but I can’t see why it wouldn’t be just as yummy.
Delicious! Don't change a thing. Surely will make this again. Thank you for the recipe.
I love this dish. I make it with wild turkey legs in a slow cooker and it turns out fantastic. I suggest using hot salsa if you like it a little spicy!

Great easy soup and fantastic way to use Thanksgiving leftovers. Hearty with just the right amount of seasoning. Followed the recipe exactly except I substituted canned chicken broth for the boullion and water. Also, no need for the sour cream or cheese on top if you are watching calories - soup was great without them.

I always freeze my left over turkey to avoid turkey overload. This year, it was getting crunch time before I had to pitch it!Then I came upon this recipe. I love nothing more than a quick and easy meal! We liked it so much, I specifically bought some turkey just to make it again!
I make it every year after thanksgiving with the leftover turkey.

Did as suggested and made turkey stock and used that instead of water. Wanted it more “diet” friendly so didn’t use sour cream and, while I tried it once with the cheese, later just omitted the cheese. Long story short, my husband who doesn’t like soup said he thought it was great and he’d eat it again. Oh and I used tomato basil soup as that’s what I had.
Love it! great way to use your leftover turkey.
I made this in my new Pro Pressure cooker and it was crazy good. I used dry black beans, no soaking and we didn't put any garnishes on top (trying to cut calories so no cheese).
Very good soup!
Great and tasty way to use up the leftover turkey.

This was fabulous! I actually have most of these ingredients in my cabinet so easy to put together! The only thing I changed was using canned chilis (1 4oz can) and the same for the olives. It just wasnt worth going to store! It gave just the perfect amount of flavor and spice. I also added a little more chicken stock because I like a little more broth. Other than that, I wouldn't change a thing. I plan on making it again, again, and again!
For the canned tomatoes I used rotele for a little extra kick. This is a great recipe!
Yummy!

We really liked this recipe. I prepped everything the night before and assembled it after work, and ready to eat within 40 minutes. I used chicken broth instead of water, added a can of chopped green chiles, more chili powder, and garnished as recommended , plus some sliced black olives and a little hot sauce. We like it spicy! Served with a salad, this was a very filling meal. I'll be making it again.

Made it exactly as directed except I added a little minute rice to make it a bit heartier. After reading some of the reviews I also added a touch of taco seasoning. I used rotel instead of plain tomatoes (I didn't have any) and I think that gave it a nice kick which worked for us. Good as written but adjust spices to your preference
Great use of leftover holiday turkey
It’s delicious! I skipped the bouillon cubes, substituted the water with chicken broth and used parsley and cilantro paste. A definite winner.
Great soup! I used tomato sauce rather than tomato soup because that is what I had. Also added a can of rotel to spice it up. Topped with FF Greek yogurt. So tasty!
Wasn't a fan. Too much tomato. Thank you though.

This has become a staple the week after Christmas Thanksgiving or Easter turkey. It is great as written but I usually sub out the canned tomato soup and replace with tomato sauce or watered down tomato paste. I also add a can of chopped green chilies which gives it just the right amount of kick- without that I find it a little bit bland. But overall a great hearty delicious soup that the whole family loves!

The only changes i made was i used the stock from the Turkey and added all bones and water with a large onion and one celery as well as a large carrot. I also cut down to two boullion cubes otherwise a very enjoyable recipe!

This was delicious. 8 of 9 kids came back for seconds, as did all the adults. We'll definitely be making this one again! I used chicken broth instead of water and bullion, and left out the tomato soup, but otherwise followed the recipe.

Made this last week using turkey stock, instead of water. The whole family, young and old thought it was great. Served with homemade focaccia bread. Will try it using chicken next time.
Thanks for a keeper recipe.
Delicious! Used frozen cooked turkey carcasses to make broth and then shredded the dark meat for the soup. Omitted the cilantro and added ground coriander.
The only change I made was using a large can of ro-tel,The soup was wonderful.Will make it again.Hubbly loved it!!
My hubby made this the other day for supper. What a GREAT way to use leftover turkey. Will definitely make this again!

Score! Looking for something to use up all this darn holiday turkey leftovers. Found this recipe quick snap. My husband and my one teenage son (my other one won't even look at a vegetable) gobbled this up. I doubled it and froze some. It re-heated wonderfully. So good. I don't think I made any changes to the recipe, which I often do. So Good. I'm making it tonight!
Healthy n good flavor. A great lunch soup for hubby. No sour cream in mine

Made it and it was delicious. I did switch out the water for part beef broth and chicken broth. Added fresh roma tomatoes because i only had a small can of crushed tomatoes. And added 1 jalapeño. The best ever. Will definitely make again!
everyone just loved it. I followed recipe to a t except I added extra bouillon. Will for sure make again.

I used no-salt chicken broth and drained the tomatoes. Worried about an overly salty taste but the soup was very very good. Also added a little hot sauce to make sure it was warm enough for our taste. Really good.
I was looking for recipes to use leftover turkey. Christmas dinner was cancelled due to weather. I had a lot of turkey to use up. This recipe was great!

Oh wow did I make it! I followed the directions except for a couple of things. I added the packaged Sazon seasoning (1 red packet), 3 huge table spoons of goya sofrito (store bought) and I made my own tortilla chips by deep frying tortilla shells. This was way better than the normal tortilla soup I buy. It was much cheaper and I loved the fact I was able to control the salt and seasonings. Oh yeah I didn't add the salsa because I don't like it very hot. My family including my niece was was a vegan (until she saw this cheesy gooey stooppppp). LOL!
Great, family loved it. Will try it with chicken next .
Outstanding! I made it exactly as written and my family gobbled it up, asked for another batch!

Wow! As we were sick of leftover turkey sandwiches fromThanksgiving I was searching for something that didn't taste too much like turkey, and yet wanted to use up my leftovers. This really hit the spot. The flavor was very, very good. Mildly spiced, so you could kick it up if you prefer. My only change is that I left out the cilantro, only because I don't like the taste. It didn't taste as if something was missing. My husband loved it.

I wasn't sure I would like it because I usually don't like to cook with canned soup. So glad I made an exception, this is fantastic. I didn't have frozen corn so I used canned. Also had no bouillon so used chicken broth. Everything else was done as recipe called for. Do not forget the cheese on top. Will make this again and again.
This soup was a great change from regular turkey soup with leftover turkey! My only "changes" were doubling the cumin, chili, and oregano....and I added some ground coriander. It was really
This is delicious! I didn't use condensed tomato soup, I used tomato sauce instead and I used the broth from the boiled-down turkey carcass instead of water and bouillon cubes.

What a great way to use up extra turkey! This is a really good, flavourful soup, the recipe is great as is. I threw is some extra sliced mushrooms and peppers that I had in the fridge just because they were lying around, but that's it. Wouldn't change a thing!

My husband and I loved it. I made a few changes to the spices as I didn't have some of the ones called for in the recipe on hand. Would definitely make it again when we have left over turkey. Thanks for the recipe! :)
I had a lot of broth from our thanksgiving turkey so was looking for an alternative to the usual turkey soup. I used turkey broth instead of the water and bouillon cubes...and it was EXCELLENT!

This recipe is incredible! I now look forward to leftover turkey! It's so flavorful, even my fussy hubby loved it and he's not usually a soup guy. The only change I made was using homemade turkey and chicken stock instead of the water and bullion cubes. As well, I had no black beans on hand so I used some chickpeas instead. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly and it's great! Because my hubby doesn't like the texture of diced tomatoes, I threw all the ingredients for the second step into a blender and had a nice smooth creamy consistency. For those worried about the salsa - don't, it works!! I also thought there would be too much corn and turkey but it's the perfect amount! Thank you, thank you, thank you for such a tasty way to use up leftover turkey!!

This was an excellent soup although I did change it up a bit to use what I had on hand so didn't give it the full 5 stars. I added 2 sliced carrots, 2 small stalks celery-diced, sliced red bell pepper (about 2/3 cup) and 4 mushrooms that I needed to use up. Omitted the sour cream. Used chicken broth instead of water and chicken bouillan. Served with shredded Mexican blend cheese and tortilla chips....very tasty, indeed. Would make this again.
I thought this was 5 stars exactly as written. Definitely give this one a try. You can always tweak the seasonings to your taste if you want it spicy, but I thought it was an excellent soup as is.
Very easy to make, quick and tasty. We added juice of limes to the soup. It added a nice zing.
Very easy to make, quick and tasty. We added juice of limes to the soup. It added a nice zing.

We kept out the onions, sour cream, and cilantro. I also made it in my crockpot instead of on the stove. It takes longer in the crock pot, but if you're not in a hurry to cook it's okay. Since we didn't do onions I just added the spices straight to the soup. Ours came out really spicy because my boyfriend decided to get the Hot Mexican Chili Powder and Spicy Salsa. I also added a tablespoon of garlic, but you couldn't really taste it. I also used cream corn on accident and it was really good. I think it calls for too much diced tomatoes so I would do a smaller can next time. We loved it though and we're going to try it again with different meats!

We loved this soup. Since I had turkey stock on hand, I used that instead of water and bouillon, but I otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I fried up strips of corn tortillas to put on top along with Monterey Jack cheese and sour cream. It was delicious.
Winner for my whole family.

Deeeeeeee-licious. I followed it exactly and I'm glad I did. It made a nice big batch of super tasty soup. I didn't serve it with the suggested garnish but with Absolute Mexican Cornbread and it's a wonderful meal.
